item.title: Kyle Benzle
The missing parts in Cargo
item.description: When people discuss the merits of Rust, they often mention its strict ownership rules, excellent diagnostics, and impressive performance. Cargo and the crates.io ecosystem frequently receive praise as well. Initially, when I started learning Rust, I couldn’t understand why Cargo was so highly loved. Having extensive experience with JavaScript, I was accustomed to convenient package managers and couldn’t grasp the enthusiasm—wasn’t such a tool a given for any serious programming language?

item.title: Crafting Interpreters
item.description: Crafting Interpreters contains everything you need to implement a full-featured, efficient scripting language. You’ll learn both high-level concepts around parsing and semantics and gritty details like bytecode representation and garbage collection. Your brain will light up with new ideas, and your hands will get dirty and calloused. It’s a blast.
